result.execSummary:
The defendant Geza Szakacs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Geza Szakacs

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Plea questionnaire, waiver of rights w/ elements and CCS form

Case called at 9:53am [mo]
Defendant Geza Szakacs in court with Attorney Timothy Mistrioty.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Mr. Szakacs  waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

The Court exercises its discretion to allow the filing of an Information that charges the misdemeanor when the complaint had formally charged a felony

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Count #1 of the Information; factual basis given; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint Recommendation of the Parties, the Court reads in and dismisses: Counts #2 and #3

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to serve 10 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence no later than 5/26/16(Court does not indicate time)
--The Court authorizes the transfer of the jail term to another county so long as it is served as it would be in Jefferson County, that is without passive confinement and without additional cost to Jefferson County
--accomplish 80 hours of community service, outside of Goodwill Industries

The Court adopts all other conditions as set forth in the Criminal Case Settlement.

[which are:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of any controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no contact with Casey O'brien or William Levenhagen
--no contact with any know drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--buy money reimbursement in the amount of $150
--to pay statutory costs

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 10:28am

Case called at 2:27 pm [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Jennifer Weber presiding for BrIII]
Defendant Geza Szakacs in court with Attorney Timothy Mistrioty. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited; DOB & address confirmed accurate
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $2500 signature bond, with conditions:
-Maintain absolute sobriety
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
-No possession of drug paraphernalia
-Booking at JCSD
off-record for scheduling: 2:32 - 2:33 pm
Court announces dates for record
Recess: 2:34 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 3/16/16 at 2:20 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 4/26/16 at 10:00 am - Send notices
